title: @Riot: Kayle, Morgana and the "Aspect Influence"

replies.body:
The difference is that Kayle and Morgana are not Aspects; they are children born of an aspect.

Kayle might have become the Aspect of Justice after her mother died, but that would be speculation.

Yep, this is correct - their mother was the Aspect of Justice, and was taken over by the Celestial being after ascending Mount Targon while unknowingly pregnant with Kayle & Morgana. When the twins were born, they had some of her Celestial power, but were not technically "Aspects" and didn't have a Celestial being using them as a mortal vessel. 

But the OP is right in how Morgana and Kayle view their Celestial power. Morgana has rejected it, choosing to walk the mortal path, while Kayle has embraced her Celestial identity and seeks to become just like her mother as the Aspect of Justice. Kayle wants to do what her mother did, which includes suppressing her human emotions and pushing down any doubt that she might be wrong, in order to serve ultimate justice and protect the innocent. This is extra difficult for Kayle because she is still herself (unlike Mihira, her mother, who merged with the Celestial).

So right now Kayle is close to become a real Celestial in a mortal body.

That could be intriguing as time passes by: Does her "soul" end up with all the other mortal ones in a cycle of reincarnation and such? If yes, does it mantain its "celestial attributes" once reincarnated? Or are them new Celestials to be added to the ranks?

> The difference is that Kayle and Morgana are not Aspects; they are children born of an aspect.
> 
> Kayle might have become the Aspect of Justice after her mother died, but that would be speculation.

Im pretty sure both Kayle and Morgana are Aspects now that their mother died. With Kayle being the emotionless sword that stikes down those that break the law and Morgana the compassionate hand that helps those in need.
Aspects are, as far as we can tell, singular beings. They can't both be the Aspect of Justice.

> [{quoted}](name=HalfTangible,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=esclNxZg,comment-id=000100010000,timestamp=2019-03-05T23:57:47.931+0000)
>
> Aspects are, as far as we can tell, singular beings. They can't both be the Aspect of Justice.

As far as we can tell. 

As far as we know, their mother was pregnant while bearing Morgana and Kayle, this could have possibly bend the rules a bit. It's not uncommon in mythos either to have multiple aspects of a certain thing represented by different embodiment. Such as Athena and Ares (and Aphrodite according to Spartan Mythos) both being gods of war but governing different aspect of it).
This is exactly what I'd like to be explored more.

Remember what Riot said about Ascended champions a while back? Aspects and Ascended are very different, but they both draw from the same cosmic well of power. Put simply, Kayle and Morgana were 'blessed' by the Aspect of Justice when it chose their mother as its host - they're basically somewhere between a perfect Ascension & Aspect in terms of power.

The power (which is drawn from the celestial aspect of Justice) is basically exaggerating their individual concept of Justice.
Everyone's assuming their mother is dead. As yet, unconfirmed.
I am well aware, thus you don't see me ever mentioning their mother as I only say that their acquisition of powers is rather peculiar as it doesn't involve any "mind-parasite" xD

Morg and Kayle are demi gods, They inherited a portion of their mothers power through the influence of the aspect residing within their mother and the legacy she left behind(twin swords).  It's their own personality and beliefs.
